Package jeroquest.boardgame

Class Board

java.lang.Object
jeroquest.boardgame.Board
public class Board
extends java.lang.Object
Programming Methodology Practice. Jeroquest - An example of Object Oriented Programming. Class Board - class that represents the game board
Author:
Jorge Puente Peinador y Ramiro Varela Arias, Juan Luis Mateo

    Constructors

    Board​(int rows, int columns)
    Create a board according to the specified dimensions (constructor)

  • Constructor Details

    • Board

      public Board​(int rows, int columns)
      Create a board according to the specified dimensions (constructor)
      Parameters:
      rows - the number of rows in the board
      columns - the number of columns in the board

  • Method Details

    • getRows

      public int getRows()
      Get the number of rows in the board
      Returns:
      the number of rows

    • getColumns

      public int getColumns()
      Get the number of columns in the board
      Returns:
      the number of columns

    • removePiece

      public void removePiece​(Piece p)
      Takes a piece out of the board
      Parameters:
      p - piece to take out of the board

    • movePiece

      public boolean movePiece​(Piece p, Direction dir)
      Place a piece in a square adjacent to the current one (overloaded method)
      Parameters:
      p - the piece to place
      dir - direction of movement: North, South, East or West
      Returns:
      true if it could be placed, false if it wasn't in the board, if the square was already occupied or if it goes out of the board

    • freeSquare

      public boolean freeSquare​(XYLocation pos)
      Checks if a square is valid and it is free
      Parameters:
      pos - position to check
      Returns:
      true if the square is free

    • movePiece

      public boolean movePiece​(Piece p, XYLocation pos)
      Place a piece in an empty square (overloaded method)
      Parameters:
      p - piece to place
      pos - square position
      Returns:
      true it the placement could be made, false if the square was occupied or it wan't valid

    • toString

      public java.lang.String toString()
      Generate a printable representation of the object (overridden method)
      Overrides:
      toString in class java.lang.Object
      Returns:
      the printable representation of the board
